{"step_by_step_thinking": "Jaw or tooth apart swallow refers to the ability to swallow with the jaw and teeth separated. This is a characteristic of infantile swallow, where infants have not yet developed the ability to coordinate their jaw and tongue movements during swallowing. Mature swallow, on the other hand, involves the coordinated movement of the jaw, tongue, and teeth during swallowing. Since jaw or tooth apart swallow is specific to infantile swallow, the correct answer is A. Infantile swallow.", "answer_choice": "A"}
